feed.title: Tag: case | Edmonds Commerce Dev Blog

entry.title: Magento Overiding XML Case Inconsistency Continues
entry.content:
Had another tearing hair out moment when trying to figure out why my helper override was working fine, but my block override wasn’t working. Here is the result:

helper working, block not working: ```xml

<?xml version=“1.0”?> 

<modules>
    <EC_CatalogSearch>
        <version>0.1.0</version>
    </EC_CatalogSearch>
</modules>
<global>
    <helpers>
        <catalogSearch>
            <rewrite>
                <data>EC_CatalogSearch_Helper_Data</data>
            </rewrite>
        </catalogSearch>
    </helpers>
    <blocks>
        <catalogSearch>
            <rewrite>
                <result>EC_CatalogSearch_Block_Result</result>
            </rewrite>
        </catalogSearch>
    </blocks>
</global>

```

then after a load of messing about, this one does work:

helper and block both working ```xml

<?xml version=“1.0”?> 

<modules>
    <EC_CatalogSearch>
        <version>0.1.0</version>
    </EC_CatalogSearch>
</modules>
<global>
    <helpers>
        <catalogSearch>
            <rewrite>
                <data>EC_CatalogSearch_Helper_Data</data>
            </rewrite>
        </catalogSearch>
    </helpers>
    <blocks>
        <catalogsearch>
            <rewrite>
                <result>EC_CatalogSearch_Block_Result</result>
            </rewrite>
        </catalogsearch>
    </blocks>
</global>

```

yeah exactly :S
